verses.verse: Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> was twelve <S%H8147><s%> <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he became <S%H4427><s%> king, <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> fifty-five years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

And he did <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> according to the abominations <S%H8441><s%> of the nations <S%H1471><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> dispossessed <S%H3423><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

For he rebuilt <S%H7725><s%> <S%H1129><s%> the high <S%H1116><s%> places <S%H1116><s%> which <S%H834><s%> Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> his father had broken <S%H1><s%> down; <S%H5422><s%> he also erected <S%H5422><s%> altars <S%H6965><s%> for the Baals <S%H4196><s%> and made <S%H1168><s%> Asherim, <S%H6213><s%> and worshiped <S%H842><s%> all <S%H7812><s%> the host <S%H3605><s%> of heaven <S%H6635><s%> and served <S%H8064><s%> them.

And he built <S%H1129><s%> altars <S%H4196><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of which <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had said, <S%H559><s%> "My name <S%H8034><s%> shall be in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>"

For he built <S%H1129><s%> altars <S%H4196><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> the host <S%H6635><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%> in the two <S%H8147><s%> courts <S%H2691><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

And he made his sons <S%H1121><s%> pass <S%H5674><s%> through the fire <S%H784><s%> in the valley <S%H1516><s%> of Ben-hinnom; and he practiced <S%H6049><s%> witchcraft, <S%H6049><s%> used <S%H5172><s%> divination, <S%H5172><s%> practiced <S%H3784><s%> sorcery, <S%H3784><s%> and dealt <S%H6213><s%> with mediums <S%H178><s%> and spiritists. <S%H3049><s%> He did <S%H6213><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> provoking <S%H3707><s%> Him [to anger.]

Then he put <S%H7760><s%> the carved <S%H6459><s%> image <S%H6459><s%> of the idol <S%H5566><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had made <S%H6213><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> of which <S%H834><s%> God <S%H430><s%> had said <S%H559><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%> and to Solomon <S%H8010><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> "In this <S%H2088><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> and in Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I have chosen <S%H977><s%> from all <S%H3605><s%> the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> I will put <S%H7760><s%> My name <S%H8034><s%> forever; <S%H5769><s%>

and I will not again <S%H3254><s%> remove <S%H5493><s%> the foot <S%H7272><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> from the land <S%H127><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I have appointed <S%H5975><s%> for your fathers, if <S%H1><s%> only <S%H518><s%> they will observe <S%H7534><s%> to do <S%H8104><s%> all <S%H6213><s%> that I have commanded <S%H3605><s%> them according to all <S%H6680><s%> the law, <S%H3605><s%> the statutes, <S%H8451><s%> and the ordinances <S%H2706><s%> [given] through <S%H4941><s%> Moses. <S%H3027><s%> "

Thus Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> misled <S%H8582><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> and the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> more <S%H4480><s%> evil <S%H9563><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> destroyed <S%H8045><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> and his people, <S%H5971><s%> but they paid <S%H7181><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> attention. <S%H7181><s%>

Therefore the Lord <S%H3068><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> the commanders <S%H8269><s%> of the army <S%H6635><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them, and they captured <S%H3920><s%> Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> with hooks, <S%H2336><s%> bound <S%H631><s%> him with bronze <S%H5178><s%> [chains,] and took <S%H1980><s%> him to Babylon. <S%H894><s%>

And when he was in distress, <S%H9503><s%> he entreated <S%H9134><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> his God <S%H430><s%> and humbled <S%H3665><s%> himself greatly <S%H3966><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of his fathers.

When he prayed <S%H6419><s%> to Him, He was moved <S%H6279><s%> by his entreaty <S%H6279><s%> and heard <S%H8085><s%> his supplication, <S%H8467><s%> and brought <S%H7725><s%> him again <S%H7725><s%> to Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> to his kingdom. <S%H4438><s%> Then Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> [was] God. <S%H430><s%>

Now after <S%H310><s%> this <S%H3651><s%> he built <S%H1129><s%> the outer <S%H2435><s%> wall <S%H2346><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> on the west <S%H4628><s%> side <S%H4628><s%> of Gihon, <S%H1521><s%> in the valley, <S%H5158><s%> even to the entrance <S%H935><s%> of the Fish <S%H1709><s%> Gate; <S%H8179><s%> and he encircled <S%H5437><s%> the Ophel <S%H6077><s%> [with it] and made <S%H1361><s%> it very <S%H3966><s%> high. <S%H1361><s%> Then he put <S%H7760><s%> army <S%H2428><s%> commanders <S%H8269><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> the fortified <S%H1219><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah. <S%H3063><s%>

He also removed <S%H5493><s%> the foreign <S%H5236><s%> gods <S%H430><s%> and the idol <S%H5566><s%> from the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> as well as all <S%H3605><s%> the altars <S%H4196><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he had built <S%H1129><s%> on the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> and in Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and he threw <S%H7993><s%> [them] outside <S%H2351><s%> the city. <S%H5892><s%>

And he set <S%H3559><s%> up the altar <S%H4196><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> and sacrificed <S%H2076><s%> peace <S%H8002><s%> offerings <S%H8002><s%> and thank <S%H8426><s%> offerings <S%H8426><s%> on it; and he ordered <S%H559><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Nevertheless <S%H61><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> still <S%H5750><s%> sacrificed <S%H2076><s%> in the high <S%H1116><s%> places, <S%H1116><s%> [although] only <S%H7534><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> their God. <S%H430><s%>

Now the rest <S%H3499><s%> of the acts <S%H1697><s%> of Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> even his prayer <S%H8605><s%> to his God, <S%H430><s%> and the words <S%H1697><s%> of the seers <S%H2374><s%> who spoke <S%H1696><s%> to him in the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> they are among <S%H5921><s%> the records <S%H1697><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

His prayer <S%H8605><s%> also and [how God] was entreated <S%H6279><s%> by him, and all <S%H3605><s%> his sin, <S%H9128><s%> his unfaithfulness, <S%H4604><s%> and the sites <S%H4725><s%> on which <S%H834><s%> he built <S%H1129><s%> high <S%H1116><s%> places <S%H1116><s%> and erected <S%H5975><s%> the Asherim <S%H842><s%> and the carved <S%H6456><s%> images, <S%H6456><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> he humbled <S%H3665><s%> himself, behold, <S%H2009><s%> they are written <S%H3789><s%> in the records <S%H1697><s%> of the Hozai. <S%H2335><s%>

So Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with his fathers, and they buried <S%H1><s%> him in his own house. <S%H6912><s%> And Amon <S%H1004><s%> his son <S%H526><s%> became <S%H1121><s%> king <S%H4427><s%> in his place. <S%H4427><s%>

Amon <S%H526><s%> [was] twenty-two <S%H8147><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he became <S%H4427><s%> king, <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> two years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

And he did <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> as Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> his father had done, <S%H1><s%> and Amon <S%H6213><s%> sacrificed <S%H526><s%> to all <S%H2076><s%> the carved <S%H3605><s%> images <S%H6456><s%> which <S%H6456><s%> his father Manasseh <S%H834><s%> had made, <S%H1><s%> and he served <S%H4519><s%> them.

Moreover, he did not humble <S%H3665><s%> himself before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> as his father Manasseh <S%H1><s%> had done, <S%H4519><s%> but Amon <S%H3665><s%> multiplied <S%H526><s%> guilt. <S%H7235><s%>
Finally his servants <S%H5650><s%> conspired <S%H7194><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him and put <S%H4191><s%> him to death <S%H4191><s%> in his own house. <S%H1004><s%>

But the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> killed <S%H5221><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the conspirators <S%H7194><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> King <S%H4428><s%> Amon, <S%H526><s%> and the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> made <S%H4427><s%> Josiah <S%H2977><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> king <S%H4427><s%> in his place. <S%H8478><s%>
